name: Melissa
review:
I was looking for a product with good coverage and something that would last all day. This foundation is perfect! It provides amazing coverage and lasts FOREVER. It's also waterproof, which was a nice surprise. I went swimming and rub water off my eyes quite often, and when I got home I noticed my makeup didn't even budge!

I apply a very small amount (about nickel-sized) to the back of my hand after shaking it well. You can apply it with your favorite foundation brush, just make sure you blend it right away - don't put dabs all over your face and then slowly blend all of them. If you don't blend it right away, it doesn't blend very easily and you'll end up streaky. The only bad thing about this product is that, since it stays on your face so well and so long, it also stays on your brush very well. It's not a big deal, I've just noticed it builds up on my brush much quicker than other foundations have, so you just might have to wash your brushes more frequently.

Overall, this is a terrific foundation. It covers blemishes very well and gives you a natural look that really does last all day. I HIGHLY recommend you buy this!

review: I very much dislike this foundation. It is absolutely AWFUL for dry skin like mine. I've tried this product many times over the course of a year. I thought trying it with different products each time would work but, nope, didn't work. Tried it with a beauty blender, a stippling brush, a normal foundation brush. Tried using less, using more, mixing it with moisturizer; nothing worked.It is cakey, super cakey; it looks like I'm legit wearing flour on my face when I apply it. It NEVER dries and it's sheer. It doesn't cover ANY of my acne scars or redness whatsoever! I've tried using it in a thick amount to get more coverage but, it was STILL sheer, no matter what method of putting it on my face I used. I thought that this was just a bad batch. So, I went back and bought two more; they were all the same. It also caused me to break out not even 4 hours later. My face was taken over by pimples and it was awful. I really, really dislike this product and I'm very unhappy with it. I don't understand why it gets so much hype but, in my opinion I don't think it deserves it. I really wished it worked for me, though.

review: I have been on the hunt for a good, affordable foundation. I have tried all the other drug store brands, plus 2 of the more expensive brands. I just wasn't finding something that met all my needs. I feel like I really have with this one! I am 26..with dry to normal skin..but I do tend to break out on my chin area. These are all the pro's I found with this foundation. 1-It blends well, I don't find that it dries to fast (before I can blend it) and can be "built up" to a full coverage on problem areas. 2- Matches my skin pretty much perfectly. Gives me a "flawless" look, with out looking caked on or "made up" up close. 3- It does Not sink into my fine smile lines to bad (any foundation will at some point in the day..some more then others). 4- It does last a very long time. Does it look perfect after 8 plus hours, No. Does my face still look fresh and nice, Yes! 5- It does NOT contain talc or fragrance (someone commented on the smell..Umm..there is no smell?) 6- Not drying or caused any breakouts. 7- Affordable! CONS- Only One: They need a better color selection. Some that contain pink undertones and some with yellow. Might be hard for some people to find there perfect match. Sooo happy I tried this foundation!!!! I really love it!

I was able to find the perfect shade for me when I had more color this summer but this winter I was not able to find the correct color for my warm skin tone. This may have been due to my local store not having all the colors in stock.

The only problem I have with this foundation is that it's really really red. It might just be because I'm in the darkest shade. Overall, I love the foundation; just wish it suited my skin tone more.

review: This stuff is great...once you find your shade. It has great coverage, last all day and is very light. I went through 3-4 bottles before I found one that isn't an exact match for my skin but close enough

name: Annabelle
review:
I recently switched from a tinted Moisturizer from a different brand because the lightest shade was still too dark for my fair skin, to this. I read a bunch of really positive reviews on this and was so excited to try it.

First, I'd like to say I have pretty sensitive skin and I've been using this for about 2 weeks and haven't broken out. I have pretty nice skin. I don't usually get acne, but sometimes I have a few zits here and there. My cheeks are a bit red.

I apply this with a damp sponge, and it covers flawlessly. It does dry very fast, but its okay. And it doesn't look cakey or fake. It looks like skin, which is the best part. It leaves a beautiful matte finish, and looks very natural, while still managing to have full coverage.

I got it in the shade ivory, and I have very pale skin. I think the ivory shade might be a bit too light for my skin, so I just mix in half a pump of a darker shade foundation. A lot of people complain of a smell, but it doesn't bother me. When I first put it on, I can tell I'm wearing foundation, but after about 10 minutes it feels like I'm not wearing anything.

It stays on all day, and still looks great when I get home. On the down side, its very hard to get off. I have to wash my face two times, and exfoliate to get it off. It also doesn't come with a pump, so its quite messy. But it's probably the best drugstore foundation I've used, and looks so good, its worth it. My friends have told me that my skin looks great! Definitely going to buy again.

name: koolklawz
review: I'm new to wearing makeup, but have heard good things about this foundation. It really is that good. This is a full coverage foundation, and I don't need much. It blends easily, and also plays well with other makeup types and formulas. I generally prefer medium coverage, so I find it a bit heavy, and it's not one I'd wear every day. It provides an excellent finish to my dry areas, keeping them matte without caking in any problem areas. It doesn't do the best job of controlling oil in my T-zone, though, and I keep the blotting papers on hand. I am considering trying the oily skin formula in those areas. Besides that, if you like full coverage, look no further.

name: Koolklawz
review: I so wanted to love this foundation. I really tried. I tried with three different brushes, at least three primers, and beauty blenders. I achieved the best result with the beauty blender. It's lightweight and feels like next to nothing on my skin. Three drops are recommended, but for medium coverage, I used 4-6 drops. It spreads nicely, and the color range is excellent. I had a couple problems, though. First, while I prefer a matte finish, I don't mind a more dewy look. Every time I've worn this foundation, though, my face is an oil slick within 2 hours. I don't even have oily skin, except for the T-zone. Secondly, this foundation clings to any dry patches, even those I can't see or feel before application. Third, if you have any blemishes or skin imperfections whatsoever, this foundation only highlights them. So, it just doesn't work for me, either on oily or dry areas, and I only see it working for those with normal skin, no acne, and no scarring.

name: Adriana
review:
My makeup drawer is full of budget and high end foundations, this one is the one I use the most. I have normal to dry skin. I moisturize my face first and allow the moisturizer to full absorb. I use about one pump and a tiny bit more if I need more coverage, dispensed onto the back of my hand. I lightly dip my It Cosmetics # 101 brush (airbrush blurring foundation brush) into this foundation and then tap tap tap onto half of my face working from the outer perimeter of the face and work inward to avoid over applying. If you over apply it will appear 'cakey' later in the day, so less is more. Also make sure if you have flaky dry patches on your skin to exfoliate throughly BEFORE you moisturize and apply this foundation, or this will settle onto those areas and look awful. If you want light coverage apply using a damp beauty blender. I need medium to full coverage so I use the foundation brush.

It really does last! I typically wear foundation 8-12 hrs and when I look in the mirror at the end of the day I'm pleased to see it has only faded a little bit but my skin still looks great. I've also tried the 'whipped' foundation version of this and that one leaves my face very matte, better for use in summer. This foundation leaves my face looking normal, like real skin, not matte or shiny. I buy 2 different colors of this foundation so I can mix them especially during the summertime when my skin is darker.

review: Third time buying this! It's my favorite foundation from the budget section. It could last a little bit longer, but does a great job for how much I'm paying. Cons: Really only two and they're not big ones. First, the formula sets really quickly, within a minute. Once that happens the foundation is more difficult to blend. I suggest applying in small sections. The second, and this might only be me, but getting it anywhere near my eyes tends to make them water like crazy. Luckily, this foundation holds up like a pro in wet conditions.

Highly recommended.

My skin reacted terribly to the different foundation. I never realized how much Colorstay for Dry Skin actually helped my skin as I wore it.
I've yet to find a foundation in Revlon's price range than can hold a candle to it.
Perfect coverage, lasts through nearly everything, has shade variety and caters to your skin type.
Couldn't ask for more :)

name: Taylor
review:
I've been looking for a foundation for a LONG time that I can wear at day, at night, and just all around, and this is it!

My skin is very fair, and I have very pink undertones (I always use the lightest and coolest shade any brand offers). Very few brands have a color that really matches my fair skin and undertones, but the Ivory shade matches my skin exactly. My sister couldn't tell on first glance that I was wearing foundation!

This foundation provides good medium coverage, and it blends really well.

The only downside is that it may irritate very sensitive skin. I have sensitive skin, and after a couple hours I felt a little tingling in my cheeks. The next day though I used a primer underneath, and the problem was gone. I'm guessing it's the SPF because this product does feel really smooth and natural on my skin.

Oh, and last thing! For me, this foundation left a slightly dewy look. I usually use Maybelline Translucent Finishing Mineral Powder on top of my foundation, so that my face looks perfectly natural (and extra soft).

review: I have been wearing MAC since I was 15, but was getting really frustrated with never having that perfect match, and I felt it was a little too thick. So I tried the Revlon ColorStay after hearing great reviews and reading that Chelsea Houska from Teen Mom 2 wears it (and she always looks great.) The first time  I got a color that was way too dark, so I went back and got a lighter shade that matched perfectly! I love it because it's not shiny, it's buildable and blends well along the neckline, and it still leaves me looking like "Barbie."

name: Ange
review: First time purchasing (on daughters suggestion) I really like it.

name: Monica
review: My skin is very picky and I start the day out with dry skin and end it with super oily skin and this foundation seems to hold up just fine! It's not cakey and when applied with a damp beauty blender it is seamless with your skin.

name: sniffles
review: Love it!

name: Mar
review: Revlon makes quality makeup at affordable prices!

name: Aaa
review: Aaaaaaaaaa

name: alpal17
review: I use a mix of high end and low end beauty products and needed a low end foundation with good coverage for the summer. I have very red cheeks that I like to cover and this did the trick and made my skin look flawless. I felt I did have to use a lot of product to acheive even a light amount of coverage though. To apply the product I put maybe 4 pumps on the back of my wrist and blend it in with dabbing motions with my beauty blender. I almost prefer this over my Clinique chubby(which I was obsessed with before buying this product)!!!!

name: Tabitha
review: I love the coverage and price. I feel like I'm moving up in the makeup world one step at a time. :)

name: rankrider67
review: I love this foundation! It's a medium coverage foundation and one of the only foundations that match my skin tone perfectly. I love the finish and it lasts all day long!

name: Spacy Tracy
review: So much better than I thought it would be. Great coverage

name: kaitlyn
review: It has a wonderful matte finish.

name: S.S.
review: It has poor coverage and it looked dry and flakey once I had applied it.

name: Dee Dee
review: The color choice was great since its usually difficult to match my skin tone. The problem is it transfers all over everything! My clothes! my kids! my cell phone! At the end of the day the product has worn off and my face looks washed out. This is even after setting with a powder.  Too bad because I really wanted to like this one.

name: Sexi Lexi 23
review: I use this product on a daily basis. Mac makeup is great but for a $$$$ this makeup is well worth the money and does the same thing Mac makeup will do.

name: AleighLo
review: I enjoy this product and use it for everyday wear. It provides pretty good coverage. I have spider veins on my cheeks (horrible, I know) and although you can still see them it's only slightly. I also love the smell of this product. I have used foundation before that smells horrible or is overpowering with smell, but this is neither of those things. My only suggestion is to only apply this product after you have fully exfoliated and moisturized your face if you have normal-dry skin. I cannot stress this enough! It really looks horrible if you don't. It looks crusty and doesn't apply well.

name: CANDY
review: USE EVERYDAY, GIVES NATURAL LOOK AND EVENS THE TONE OF YOUR SKIN

name: Jenn
review: Out of all the foundations I have tried recently, this one is by far my favorite! I fell in love with the CG outlast 3 in 1 foundation, and this still blew it out of the water!!It goes on great, and matches my skin coloring perfectly! And when I wipe it off at night, there is not much on the towelette, because you do not need a lot for good coverage! Awesome! If you are not sure, just take my word for it, and go get you some!

name: ra
review: great full coverage!

name: Sarah C
review: Overall the product just wasnt for me. I used it on a Saturday night, went out and after sweating all night, it still stayed on so that was good. But the next day I had a few breakouts, and only after one night of wearing it. It didn't settle into my skin well which made it feel mask like. It definitely does last so I'll give it that bit it just wasn't for me.

name: CM
review: This makeup is the best I have found for the money.  It is very smooth when applied, sets quickly and lasts all day.  I have oily skin and this makeup keeps me shine free for many hours.

name: Jelly
review: Best drugstore-priced product by far. I have very oily skin and foundation always wears off my face within a couple hours, especially in the summer. This foundation is perfect for me, has lots of shades, and it lasts all day. However, it can get cakey if you apply too much, and it is very easily buildable, so be careful with that.

name: Diana
review:
I use this product everyday and love it!! It gives my skin an even tone and lasts all day long.

I get more compliments on my skin and women ask me specifically what make up I use?

name: Kisha
review: I finally found a foundation that blends so good with my skin.

name: Beth
review: I love revlons photo ready oundation but wanted something without the shimmer.  I use a cc cream in the summer, but was looking for something a bit heavier for winter.  This covers very nicely, at a medium coverage I would say, but can be buildable.  It does stay put and does not fade.  I've worn it up to 12 hours with no problems.    I do use it with a primer.

name: Jeanne
review: I used it every day.

name: My
review: I feel that if you prime your face before and use something to cover any pimples, this gives you full coverage! I love that I found a foundation that literally lasts until I take it off and it blends into my skin sooooo well.

name: bether
review: I love how light it is and how it matches with my skin tone.

name: venus
review:
I really love this foundation for those days I need it to last all day and when it's hot and don't need touching up, with this foundation I can skip primer AND powder and it looks gorgeous!!
using a sponge is the best way to apply this in my experience, and when I don't that much coverage (it's medium to full) you can mix it with a moisturizer so you can get sheer coverage like a tinted moisturizer but the lasting power/flawless finish as the foundation! :)

my only problem is, that I need the dry to normal formula for winter when my cheeks get dry spots and they don't have my shade :/ in the oily/combo I'm golden or warm beige but they don't have either one for dry so I'll have to try medium beige and I'm hoping it's not too light for my skin

other than that I think this foundation is such a life saver!
I never have to worry about transferring, or me getting oily through out the day
no touch ups at all
and it makes me face seem like porcelain!
absolutely love it, recommend it to everyone

name: Eppa AZ gal
review: I work far from home and I need a makeup that is going to last at least 16 hours. Colorstay Foundation is the ONLY foundation I found that last that long or longer. It's the one I have used for many years. It's the only one that lasts in Arizona Summer months and during Monsoon season!

name: Sue
review: Have been using this makeup for a couple years and I love it.  Great coverage that lasts all day.

name: Hayli
review: I bought this because of all the hype on youtube and reviews I've seen. During the summer this is my every day foundation ! You can customize your coverage, which is great. Even with a heavier coverage, my skin still looks great. The finish is a natural, matte finish that will last ALL DAY LONG. If you have dry patches I would NOT recommend, so I will steer clear  tof this this winter due to it emphasizing dry patches/flakiness. All in all if you have a normal skin type, this could be your new BFF.

name: Vonda
review: I've tried many products, and this for me is the best.

name: Lou
review: This foundation is wonderful. I will say, though, that if you have any dry patches on your skin to exfoliate before you use this foundation because it will cling to those dry areas and make it look a little cakey

name: caprine1
review: Coverage is very patchy and unnatural

name: DoggieMom86
review: Initially when I put this product on I loved it. It blended so well and provided good coverage. After being on for about 20-30 minutes it turned orange!! I'm really disappointed. I wish I had a more positive experience like everyone else.

name: Bayleigh
review: I always have trouble finding a base i like but with how smooth and flawless this is, i've found one i really like! It has good coverage and helps cover blemishes.

name: Ria
review: I use this product everyday.

name: Sara Joy
review: I tried this after using the Ulta brand foundation, which wouldn't last all day and would clump on my cheeks and rub off. The Revlon foundation does not rub off and lasts all day. I dont have to worry about checking myself in the mirror multiple times per day any more. Magic in a bottle.

name: Olivia Begnel
review: This product is very great, and medium coverage! && It really does stay on all day! The only problem i have is that it makes my pores more visible. There are definitely pore filling primers, which i would suggest using.

name: Blue Violet
review:
Good

Good

name: Betty
review: Great product !

name: T
review: Used a primer prior to application.

name: Tiff
review: The best foundation I've found yet.  I've seen professional makeup artist use this and remove the label so no one knows.   Wonderful product.

name: Mari
review: Stays on for a long time and has an airbrush finish effect on your skin!

name: Alexandra
review: I use this everyday and people always say how they love my foundation. I have tried multiple prestige brand foundations and I always go back to this one. The price is nice too, I sometimes will find a coupon or Ulta will have a BOGO 50% off. I use a primer and apply with a brush and beauty blender and finish with a setting powder. And it gives me a FULL coverage look. I have some acne scars and a lot of redness so that's what I require. From when I put it on in the AM to later in the night it stays put and I never get oily or feel the need to touch up. LOVE IT!!!

name: jess
review: Ok I dislike this foundation with a slight passion. It look caked on and it's so blotchy. I swear it doesn't have that great of coverage and I have sensitive skin so it irritates my skin. Overall, do NOT waste your money or a perfectly good one time use coupon ;( im sad I wasted it

name: Amber
review: I have pretty normal skin. Sometimes I get dry patches on my cheeks and my T-zone can get oily at times. I don't normally break out but I do have dark circles and some discoloration all over. This foundation covers my dark circles easily without any sort of concealer under or over it. I apply it with a beauty blender and it works wonders. Great coverage. However, sometimes what I have a long shift at work I notice that the foundation starts coming off at around 8 hours of wear. So I'm not sure if that whole "24-hour" lasting power is for other people. Overall, a great buy!

name: LW
review: Lasts all day, even when used with a moisturizer. Apply lightly for a more natural look.

name: Bibntucker
review: I use this product daily.  It is gentle on my sensitive skin.  I love that is has sunscreen and that it covers up flaws.  It has very good coverage and does not come off until you are ready to take it off.

name: sandydee12
review: I have been using this product with a beauty blender, over top of facial moisturizer and primer and I find this foundation very drying. I apply in the morning and by the afternoon it looks flaky and dry. I don't think it has the best coverage. The color is great though. It is one of the ivory foundations that matches my light skin.

name: Steph
review: This makeup works great! It lasts all day and is natural looking which I love.

name: Danielle
review: This is my go to foundation. I always buy this because I love how well it covers and lasts all day

name: Beautiful Woman
review: I'm pleased with the natural appearance, it's easy and quick to apply, and it blends in.  For years I've dealt with make up on my clothing, the sink, and around my collar, since I began using it, I don't have to worry about my clothes. I can't believe how long it lasts and the quality of the product.

name: Rose
review: This is truly water proof and very matte. I prefer a skin like finish over a matte finish so I mixed this with my bb cream and it was still water proof!

name: stacycakes
review: love this foundation great medium coverage foundation and its matte finish. its a little messy though and hard to get off your hands but lasts all day.

name: Tasha
review: I have tried MANY brands for my pale hyper pigmented super dry acne prone skin. I've tried the $6 products all the way up to the $42 product and this is hands down THE BEST. I am so happy I found it. I think some of the bad reviews is just bc it was maybe the formula without Soft Flex is maybe cakier otherwise I don't see how this doesn't work for everyone. My only dislike is that it doesn't come with a pump otherwise, it's great!

name: Make-up McKenna
review: I loved how it went on my skin! It covered my acne beautifully and didn't flake on my dry skin. There were no dry patches either. This stayed on all night! I wore it to prom and even with the sweating and partying going on, this stuff stayed. The only con is that I wouldn't wear it on a daily basis for summer. That is just because I like light coverage during summer.

name: misty
review: Great foundation. Various shades to choose from. And different formulas for different skin types. Really don't need a lot of product.

name: Palme497
review: I'm outdoors all day for my job so I needed a liquid foundation that would provide adequate coverage but still protect my skin. I don't like super heavy foundations, they make my face look cake-y and if you sweat it just looks awful. This foundation does the trick for me. It isn't heavy so I don't feel like I have a pound of make up on my face. It provides SPF 15 so you have some protection from the Sun. And, it wears well throughout the day.

name: KC
review: I love this foundation. I was in a wedding recently and all of the bridesmaids and the BRIDE used this for the wedding. It's full coverage and stayed on all through the day and night. It doesn't take much to cover your whole face with a make up brush (or your fingers).

name: kt's mom
review: Goes on very smooth and even.

name: Rayne
review: This product is better and cheaper than MAC match master IMO

name: Dar
review: I use a genuine beauty blender moistened when applying.Stays on through sweat humidity etc.Set it with loose powder.

name: Ali
review:
I have used Revlon colorstay for over 4 years because it has never disappointed me! Although this is for normal/dry skin it is a matte finish... I haven't needed to buy a new one yet so I don't know if they've reformulated it or just added a pump to the foundation, but the original without the pump does have a matte finish.

I have very very dry skin and prefer a satin/dewy foundation, but because the coverage, and longevity of this foundation is so good I don't mind that it is matte! I just to hydrate my skin before and afterwards and use as little powder as possible. Nothing at the drugstore compares to Colorstay.

name: Young&Confident
review: I use this product everyday to give me a flawless finish to my face. I have a lot of redness in my face and this product is great at giving me an even skin tone.

name: Lovemakeup
review: I actually meant to get the one for combo skin, however I really like this one. It's still very matte.  I'm curious to see how it sits on the skin later in the day since my t-zone does get oily. I would compare this to maybeline's matte and pore less in the shade 112 but maybelines have a pink undertone where as Revlon is yellow which I am so happy about! I bought 3 different shades of the maybeline hoping for more yellow but they were all pinkish ...at least to me anyways. I would definitely recommend this foundation.

name: lyndsey1bomb
review: Its just like any other liquid foundation.... that made me sad. I looked around for one and everyone said this one would give me a good coverage and stay. This one made my skin look dry and flakey.... I have a very smooth face. And normal oils. So nothing would really interfer with it. I don't like it you might.

name: MN
review: I have tried a few drugstore foundations and this one is my favorite. It goes on easily on my skin and lasts a long time. It's not a heavy foundation as well.

name: Kaitlin
review: Works well. Best coverage I've found for a drugstore product. There are many shades to choose from. Doesn't take a lot of product to get full coverage and it does last all day if you prime and set it with powder.  It does feel heavy and is a little runny when applying compared to using dermablend or tartes Amazonian clay foundations - however at a third of the price I would gladly sacrifice that due to the fact it still covers well.

name: Stephade
review: I bought this brand and foundation type from a reccomendation by tanya Burr on YouTube and it is such a natural looking make-up. It blends very well, looks natural, gives a dewy look and lasts all day. the only con, which i wouldn't consider it a bad con is that it is a light to medium coverage. You could probably build up the coverage with a beauty blender, but I only use a foundation brush. Another thing to know about this make-up brand's colors/shades is that the lightest shade is called ivory and is a true ivory color, but then the second and third shades are actually a medium color with orange/yellow tints and are called sand and buff and the next shade is called a nude but would be a classic ivory based on all other brand names for this shade. I mix one pump of ivory and one pump of nude to get my shade. Also, they have pumps on them!

name: Nikki
review: Love it

name: Chloe
review: If you are looking for full coverage this product is not for you, unless you want to look cakey. However, they have a good shade range to pick from. The foundation lasts pretty long too.

name: teli56
review: I had used this foundation for a year and then I stopped to try another one. I hated any other foundation other than this that I tried!!

name: Kahely
review: Wonderful product

name: Lex Luthor
review:
Having freckles I've always wanted to conceal; I've tried tons of foundations in my lifetime. They have been ranging from MAC, MUFE, Bare Minerals, drugstore brands and all else.

MAC made me break out, MUFE dried my skin to a crisp, Bare Minerals sloughed off my face like no other -- I've been at a loss my whole life! Eventually I decided to try out more cost-friendly products, since I was throwing away money buying the top brands only to have poor results.

This product works very well, especially for the price. It is definitely full-coverage, so on days I want less coverage, I mix it with some primer and moisturizer on the back of my hand before applying. I did try the Revlon BB cream, with not so good results. Mixing my own works just fine!

I can go from full-coverage without mixing to a nice sheer coverage easily. The product does not break me out but I do get a bit dry in my problem areas, although this is a small price to pay considering the value of this product.

name: TayBay
review: Use powder for extra matte finish.

name: Rouge
review: I have uneven skin tone and I've been using studio fix by MAC for years, until I found this product. The coverage is amazing and it stays on all day. I highly recommend it...oh ya and the price is great!

name: Nancy
review: I love this product. I have tried others but this one is my favorite. It is long lasting which I look for in a foundation. It does an excellent job covering imperfections and redness.

name: bubbles
review: only foundation i can wear

name: Emily
review: This is the best drugstore brand foundation I have ever used. I have acne and this foundation does a fantastic job of hiding hyper pigmentation and discoloration. It lasts all day too, which means there is no need for reapplication throughout the day. There are a ton of color options as well. My only complaint is that it can be drying, which highlights any flaking or fine lines you may have. Also, if not applied right, it can look cakey because it is so full coverage.

name: LH
review: I have used the normal to oily skin type for several years and love it. However, as my skin is becoming dryer I chose this normal to dry skin type fro a bit more moisture. It goes on smooth and stays all day and doesn't rub off on clothes etc. I highly recommend this product.

name: Dancing Donna
review: I love the staying power of this foundation.  The color stays true and doesn't fade or disappear as the day goes on.  It stays on until I take it off.

name: NAt
review: If your looking for a great cheap foundation get dream mousse

name: rt
review: the great thing is result after using this product

name: S11
review:
Simply perfect. Lasted me the 12-hour shift, didn't change colors like 'Ivory'-colored foundations usually do, and didn't cause my skin to dry/breakout.

Keep in mind that the formulas with Softflex are slightly different than those without it. I bought foundation without Softflex as it didn't have the yellow undertones to it.

Overall, I'm glad I found this foundation. Definitely ditching my previous $30 one.

name: kaliza
review: Long lasting, best drugstore foundation i have ever used. Rrom work to dinner with friends and finally home at 10pm and it was still there.

name: ultashopper
review: I applied this with a brush and it went on great.  Good coverage, good match to my skin, lasted all day.  The bad part was the smell.  I suppose I could get over the smell, but I feel like there are products out there that have similar coverage, but no smell.

name: skincareexpert
review: I like this foundation soooo much. The only thing that keeps me from using it is that pretty much all the colors (in combo to oily and normal to dry) have pink undertones. I purchased this product in both skin formulas. The normal to dry one is extremely pink and i definitely cannot wear it, the combination to oily one is not as pink undertoned but still not yellow enough. I'm pretty sad that revlon makes primarily pink undertoned foundation in their Colorstay line. I would purchase this product again if they made more yellow undertoned foundations. Other than the undertones i love it but sad cannot wear :(

name: Louisiana Lady
review: I use this brand makeup every single day and this product has kept it's high quality over all the years that I have been using it.

name: Mimi
review: It doesn't rub off. Stays on all day,even through a 5 hour round of golf. My favorite base makeup.

name: Blondie
review: I have used shades from normal/dry & combo/oily line they both have different color even though same number. When you find the shade for you it is good coverage for less. Do blend before it dries. I used as setting powder over it and it stays on all day until I wash it off at night or in the morning.

name: Alie Girl
review: I wear this on NIGHTs out.  While it is matter...i top with a brighting powder.  It will last all night.

name: makeupaholic
review: This product makes my skin look flawless! One of the best purchases I have ever made!

name: Kaylaluv
review: I found that the best way to use this product is with some sort of flat top foundation brush. You have to make sure that when you blend it, that you blend it quickly because it will adhere to your face and not want to budge. What I really love about this foundation, is that is gives awesome coverage, but isn't thick or super heavy. You know you are wearing a foundation, yet it doesn't feel like you are going to smear it over everything. It lasts a long time, but I do find that it can begin to dry out during the course of the day and start to look cakey. It's hard to imagine that it dries out when this formula is made for normal to dry skin. What I recommend doing for those who have dryer skin such as myself, is putting on a really good moisturizer or moisturizing primer immediately before putting on the foundation and setting the foundation with a setting spray like the urban decay all nighter, or chill setting spray. I hope this helped!

name: Glossy Red
review: I was looking for a daily makeup to replace my expensive one, and gave this a try (and I heard a girl in the store recommending it to her friend).  I don't usually buy Revlon, but this was a good purchase.  Very long-lasting and covers well, without making me break out like some other inexpensive brands.  Sounds good to me!

name: S
review: Worst drugstore foundation I've used thus far. It only made my skin look even more dry and it looks cakey too easily. It's not very easy to blend and it's not easy to take off either. I would not recommend this product.

name: Ray
review: I use this foundation everyday. It's full coverage yet doesn't feel heavy on the face. It is build able but it will look cakey if you wear too many layers. I apply this with my fingers. If you have really dry skin I would recommend applying this with a beauty blender.

name: smilelanie
review: Been using this foundation for about 14 yrs. It is amazing for evening out skin tone. I am a waitress with 10+ hr shifts and it holds up every time.  I try other foundations, even the more expensive ones, and I always come back to this within days. It is a wonderful product. Not sure I will ever switch.

name: CkyBby
review: I saw several people on YouTube say that this was a dupe for the Estee Lauder Double Wear foundation. No, it's not. The Double Wear Light is my holy grail go-to foundation. This Revlon foundation was drying to my face and just didn't look or feel natural. I got it in Natural Beige and that fit me perfectly. I love the glass bottle packaging (that everyone else in the world seems to hate). I so wanted to love it, but it just didn't work for me.

name: Fortheloveofmakeup
review: I use Mac Studio Sculpt foundation daily and was looking a drugstore dupe & this fits the bill. My skin is very sensitive and I began to breakout with daily use so I discontinued use.  That said if your looking for a dupe & dont have acne prone skin this is a good one!

name: Denny
review: Product can be used with cover stick to conceal blemishes and flaws.  Nonstreaking coverage.

name: FARAHWAY
review: I adore this foundation, I've been searching for a foundation for my extremely dry skin, and this was the best one i found that costs this little. It could be long lasting if you set it with some power or setting spray, mine usually stay on for a good 6 hours and more. I use the shade toast, and i feel like its a tad bit too dark for me, but the next shade up is too light, so i have to stick with "toast" and mix it with a lighter foundation. I'm happy with this product because for the price, you can not find better, especially if you have dry skin like i do. Highly recommend this product!!!

name: Scotti
review: Very pigmented and blends very well. It lasted me all night!

name: TallKatie
review: I have tried so many foundations over the years, at all different price points, and for me, nothing beats this "old reliable." I cannot believe how much I love this foundation. I have combination skin with some dry, flaky spots, so I use this formula for dry skin. I also have the uneviable problem that my face sweats a lot. It's so frustrating, and it is so difficult to find a good foundation that will hold up in warm humid weather. This is hands down the best I've found. It's not perfect, nothing stays on perfectly through sweating and blotting, but this is so much better than anything else. And it looks natural, gives good coverage, comes in nice shades, and is easy to get ahold of. I apply it with a damp beauty blender, apply concealer and then powder, and I'm good to go for the day. Usually no touch-ups required.

name: Dancer
review: The foundation is very lightweight consistency so I generally layer on a second coat. Although it is lightweight it covers light brown spots. The 200 shade works great for my complexion which is fair with cool undertones.

name: Tee
review: Love finding products of my darkskin tone.

name: Tiffsbeautyspot
review: I love this foundation! It's literally as nice as my high end makeup. It stays all day without creasing, it's buildable and never looks cakey. It's so comfortable too! I have combo skin but This does not cause oil slicks. I love it. I definitely recommend it !! The Whipped version is Just as nice w/ a bit more coverage

name: C.
review: Can be layered for better coverage and lighter than it's whipped counterpart. Glad I finally came back to it. Good for everyday wear without worrying about it.

name: Traci T.
review: I'm 42 years old with normal to dry skin.  When it comes to skin care products, money is no object. I have spent hundreds of dollars trying foundation after foundation to find the ONE foundation that gives me all of the following..full coverage without having to cake layers of make up on, lightweight feel, and most importantly, a long lasting wear. Without naming brands I've tried both liquid and powder foundations spending anywhere from $12.00 to $50.00 and STILL not ONE gave me all of the above!  Until Now!!!!  I'm absolutely blown away by this foundation.  I prefer a liquid over a powder, especially at my age. And this by far is, shockingly, the best! It applies beautifully with a foundation brush or beauty blender, it provides full coverage with one coat, and it lasts for hours!! It's funny to me that I found this product and it didn't cost me $40-$50!! Its affordable and again, the best I've ever tried!  Thank you Revlon, you nailed it!!

name: LH
review: I have used this product for several years and love it. It stays on all day and one time had to leave it on overnight and still looked great.

name: Sue
review: I love the fact that it stays on all day. I get hot at work and I don't have any problems keeping it on.

name: Lisa
review: I have tried a ton of foundations. All price ranges and I always go back to Colorstay.

name: Gina
review: I would not recommend this product. It seemed good at first but I noticed the longer it stays on, the dryer my skin looked. Even though I can't see any dry skin before I apply it, it's cery noticeable once the foundation is applied. It also goes on streaky.

name: Obtuse Goose
review: Good for every day use, covers well. Good bargain.

name: Mgibb
review: Absolutely love this foundation. My dermatologist recommended this product for me because I am acne prone. I have this foundation and the urban decay all nighter foundation and I choose this foundation over the other often.

name: Makeup newbie
review: This is a great product! It offers good coverage without feeling heavy and cakey. It does have a little mroe shine than I would like but with some powder it's normally just fine. It's a good price. It blends well and just looks great! I think this is my new foundation!! I am definitely going to purchase this again.

name: Brooke
review: I love that it has a pump now! I used to use this foundation in college. Saw that it had a pump and was like score! I do feel like it is heavier then some of my more higher end foundations but for someone who just is wanting more coverage and is on a budget its great!

name: olivia
review: I dont know if I just got a bad bottle, but I did not like this foundation at all! It was light coverage on me and excentuated alot of my fine lines and showed some of my dry patches. Did I possibly get a bad bottle or like is the lightest shade not that formulated well? i dont know

name: Ris
review: It's my go to foundation for everyday wear.

name: Jackie
review: I finally ran out of my first bottle of this foundation, which is a first for me!  With other foundations (drugstore & highend), the color will oxidize halfway through use and I have to throw it away.  I use the color fresh beige and it's a perfect color match!  It provides a very natural finish and medium coverage.  I get lots of compliments from friends and family saying that my skin looks great, when it's really just the foundation! name: Mira

review: it had a nice medium coverage and stayed put all day.

name: Trendy gal

I love how the product blends on dry skin

name: Katie with the Freckles
review:
Great Coverage
Not Enough moisturizer in product for dry skin

name: bundles
review: the only product i trust

name: lilu
review:
I stopped using my Diorskin and Vitalumiere because this is simply much much better. I can't say enough good things about this foundation.
It looks like sekond skin and the shades match perfectly.
Also the normal/combo does not have the bad smell like the oily one wich makes it even more awesome.

I since have been on accutane and have incredibly dry skin now so I switched to the dry/normal one and it's still my favorite! Doesn't make my skin feel dry at all and it covers up any of my scars.

review: Being a super pale person, I chose the lightest color which fit me great when I used it ( kinda looked greyish). When people say it turns orange and oxidizes..they arent kidding. review: Nice!

review:
I tend to change out foundations a lot. But this is one I always come back to.
It lasts all day and it has good coverage.
The only downside is, if you have REALLY dry skin (like me), you will need to use hydrating primer underneath it. Or it will faintly cling to dry patches. I have yet to find a foundation that doesn't do that, since my skin is so dry.

name: Mel
review: Like what I titled it it was my holy grail foundation. I still do like it but after I tried the Tarte clay foundation, the Revlon colorstay have gone down on my list. It's because of the very bad creasing it does into fine lines and wrinkles and it transfers bad with or without powder or spray. Tarte foundation has a matte finish so it doesn't transfer and yes does creases but as long as I put a good primer under it it won't crease as much where Revlon does no matter what primer I use is creases like crazy. Tarte foundation is more money compared to Revlon but I would rather spend more money towards Tarte to get more positive out of it but the Revlon is still good just not as good though. It's still a lot better than Covergirl Trublend though. If your stuck between this Revlon colorstay vs Covergirl Trublend pick Revlon trust me.

name: Rubyred
review: It's a good every day foundation and I often wear it to work. It has buildable coverage that starts off medium but is easy to layer in areas that need heavy coverage.  Doesn't look cakey and doesn't settle into fine lines. Blends really well and feels light on your face.

name: Tor
review: It doesn't make me look dry like most foundations!

name: emy

location: Washington DC, United States of America
review: The first time I used this foundation was with a primer (Maybelline Blur + Smooth) and a setting spray (Elf). Only thing good about this product is that it's super easy to apply with a sponge (Brush didn't work out too good for me) Maybe I should have used a fluffier brush rather than a dense one.

name: Katy
review: There are certain products that I insist on buying high end, and others that I find the drug store does slightly better at. Somehow, this is one of them. I have tried SO many foundations over the years, including pretty much every popular foundation on Youtube, and I always come back to Revlon. I would say that my skin is more "combo" than "dry," but the combo/oily version just looks a tiny bit too cakey for my dry patches. Despite my skin not necessarily being "normal/dry," this still wore beautifully. At the end of the day, I didn't want to take my makeup off because it still looked gorgeous. It didn't accentuate anything I wouldn't want it to, it didn't cake up, and it was just the perfect amount of glow without looking oily.

name: sweaty and pale
review: I usually only buy from cruelty free brands, but I have tried EVERYTHING that's affordable, and nothing has been really good. They're either super sheer, too orange/pink, cake, or they melt off my face way too fast. With a music festival coming up on the hottest weekend of the year, I needed something long-lasting. I bought this foundation (even though it isn't cruelty free) and I LOVE IT! The best thing I've tried EVER! It has amazing coverage and would probably last through the apocalypse. Blends well, stays matte, and even has SPF! The color (I'm "Buff" for once in my life) is a great match for me, too. A great yellow-toned pale shade. I've noticed sparkle on my hand, but not on my face, so don't worry about it. SO happy with this product! Will never use another!

review: I have 2 issues with the product. 1. The combination/oily version actually makes me more oily by the end of the day. The normal/dry has a orange pink undertone which I hate and the combination/oily has more yellow brown undertone which I like. I need the normal / dry since it's less greasy but its a huge pain having to keep going back and forth exchanging trying to find the right color and type. I'm probably going to give up on this brand all together.

name: Dee
review: This is a great product. It is a light to medium coverage that lasts very well. The new color is perfect for very light to light skin tones. I usually use for  normal to oily skin, but tried this due to having some oily areas and dry areas. It went on smoothly and did not make my skin oily. This is also a great price considering how well it covers and lasts.

name: Makeup enthusiast
review: The foundation lasts long and provides good coverage. It is buildable so if you need extra coverage for blemishes it will do the trick. I have acne prone skin and it covers my scars and blemishes well. It works best for me with a beauty sponge applicator.

name: BW
review: Love this!

name: Ashley L.
review:
So I'm usually only wear BB cream to blur and cover the redness in my face. But I go out dancing a lot and needed a foundation to keep me from looking like a strawberry after exiting the sweaty dance floor.

I researched this "low end" foundation extensively and found it to be the best in the market for under 12$. And let me say. WOW.

I tested it last night on a particularly hot Florida evening at a dance party and I have to say A+++.
My redness peaked through a little in the form of rosy cheeks but all in all this stuff really hit the mark.

It blends easy, and goes on reletively smooth and matte but doesn't dry my skin out. I checked my make up at 4 am after numerous clumsy dance sessions, beer guzzling and a light night swim in the neighbors pool and it still looked as pristine as when I first applied it.

review: This product literally last all day and I love it. I love that this product is made for people with dry skin. It is my favorite foundation and would totally recommend it for those with dry/sensitive skin!

review: I forgot how much I love this! It was one of my first foundations, before it had the pump. I've tried dozens of high end and drugstore foundations since then and have just recently fallen back in love with this after one of Kathleenlights' videos. I put it on this morning at 9am and didn't get home until 11pm and it STILL looked perfect! I'm 16 and have breakouts because of hormones and age, and it covers them well. If I have bad breakouts I add a little extra on my cheeks and I'm good to go. My skin is dry and for the first time in months I got a nice clean dewy feel to my skin because of this foundation! I love it so much. my skin actually even got a little tiiiiiny bit oily at the very end of the night, but I honestly quite enjoyed finally having a little glow to my skin hahahaha. I'm not sure I'd recommend for oily skin though, it could get too greasy. But for the unfortunate dry skin guys and girls out there it works absolute wonders!

name: Cathy
review: I love this product!  It suits my needs.  I nearly panic when the sales are on an my color is out of stock.  I get better pricing at Ulta, and don't even bother with the drugstore sales and coupons if I can get to my nearby Ulta store.

review: Absolutely loved this foundation, lasted me all day and went on so well. Definitely will buy gain

name: Becky
review: Love this product!!!

name: Beauty Girl
review: I like that's it's good for the price but it did cause minor breakouts around my chin after a few uses not immediately.

name: Rachel
review:
It seems that I've been in the market for a good foundation for years. I have semi-oily, acne-scarred skin that struggles to look good under heavy makeup. I wanted something pigmented enough to cover my scarring, but light enough that it wouldn't sit heavily on my skin. I'm SO thankful that I got a recommendation for this product!

I use Revlon Colorstay Foundation every morning. I find it easiest to apply lightly with my fingers, blending it well for a natural finish. It covers the worst of my scars and doesn't look cakey under powder. It lasts all day, even through 2 classes and 2 jobs, and I rarely need to powder my T-zone at all.

Although I have semi-oily skin, I use the normal/dry formulation for Revlon Colorstay Foundation. I find that it blends in much more easily and it leaves a natural finish on the skin, as opposed to the matte finish left by the oily/combination skin formula. Someone with very oily skin, however, might find the oily/combo a better fit. I also appreciate the color range. I'm extremely fair, and most foundations and powders sit too dark and orangey on my face. The ivory 110 fits me perfectly, and I don't feel like I have to blend it down onto my neck for a natural look.

I wish that Revlon would change the packaging of this product. I do not like the bottle; it always seems that I get too much or too little of the foundation, and it tends to get all over the neck and cap as well. If this had a pump, it would be absolute perfection!

name: Mare
review: Lasts ALL day. Great coverage. Many colors to choose from.Great price.

name: JackMe the Kracken
review: Love this product.

name: Amara
review: I bought this foundation about 3 weeks ago after hearing nothing but great things about it. This foundation has easily become my new favorite. I have extremely dry skin and up until now have never been able to find a foundation that I can use heavily without looking cakey. It applies smoothly and covers my redness extremely well. I didn't think this foundation could get any better until I wore it for 15 straight hours and it stayed put the ENTIRE time! The only slight problem I have with it is finding a good shade for my skin-tone. I have extremely pale, ivory skin, and even the lightest shade of this foundation is a tad too dark. But nonetheless, I love this foundation and will continue using it! Would definitely recommend this to a friend!
